subject: Sexual Health
title: Twins and Multiples
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Twins and Multiples.

hook.text: Twins happen in two very different ways, and one type shares identical DNA while the other does not.

buildup.text: Fraternal twins occur when two separate eggs are fertilized by two different sperm in the same cycle.

discovery.text: Identical twins form when a single fertilized egg splits into two separate embryos within days.

twist.text: Fertility treatments have dramatically increased twin and triplet rates by stimulating multiple eggs.

climax.text: Scientists still do not fully understand why some embryos split to create identical twins.

punchline.text: Two eggs or one split. Nature's two-for-one deals.

quiz.question: How do identical twins form?
options: Two eggs fertilized by two sperm
One fertilized egg splits in two
